problem.markdown:
1. Accuracy is defined as a () Minimum output voltage () The smallest possible change in the output voltage (x) Measure of the difference between the actual output voltage and the expected output voltage () None of these
2) The output if a 2-input gate is 1 if and only if its input are unequal it is true for () Equal increment in input gives equal increment in output (x) Difference between actual output and measure output () Smallest possible change in the output voltage as a fraction or percentage of full scale output voltage () Both 1 and 2
3) The practical use of binary-weighted digital-to-analog converters is limited to: () R and 2R ladder D A converters (x) 4-bit D A converters () 8-bit D A converters () 8-bit D A converters
4) Resolution is defined as a (x) Smallest possible change in the output voltage as a fraction or percentage of full scale output voltage. () Difference between actual output and measure output () Equal increment in input gives equal increment in output () Both 1 and 2

choicegroup.choice: The smallest possible change in the output voltage
Measure of the difference between the actual output voltage and the expected output voltage

problem.p: 2) The output if a 2-input gate is 1 if and only if its input are unequal it is true for

choicegroup.choice: Equal increment in input gives equal increment in output
Difference between actual output and measure output
Smallest possible change in the output voltage as a fraction or percentage of full scale output voltage

problem.p: 3) The practical use of binary-weighted digital-to-analog converters is limited to:

choicegroup.choice: R and 2R ladder D A converters
Smallest possible change in the output voltage as a fraction or percentage of full scale output voltage.
Difference between actual output and measure output
Equal increment in input gives equal increment in output
